entries.title: FA Cup highlights: Man Utd 3-1 Everton
entries.description: Watch highlights as Marcus Rashford creates two goals and scores an injury-time penalty to give Manchester United a 3-1 FA Cup third-round win against Everton.

entries.title: Premiership: Gloucester 16-19 Saracens - Owen Farrell clinches win with late drop-goal
entries.description: Owen Farrell scores a last-minute drop-goal as Saracens beat Gloucester 19-16 in a Premiership thriller at Kingsholm.

entries.title: FA Cup: David de Gea lets ball go through legs to gift Everton goal against Man Utd
entries.description: Watch as Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea allows the ball to go through his legs, gifting Conor Coady a goal for Everton during their FA Cup third round tie at Old Trafford.

entries.title: Kevin McCarthy says he has votes to become US House Speaker
entries.description: Despite losing 13 votes, the Republican says he will prevail when lawmakers reconvene on Friday night.

entries.title: Manchester United 3-1 Everton: Marcus Rashford shines as Man Utd beat Everton in FA Cup
entries.description: Manchester United move into round four of the FA Cup thanks to a hard-fought victory over Everton at Old Trafford.

entries.title: FA Cup archive: Paul Gascoigne shines as Tottenham beat Portsmouth in 1991
entries.description: Ahead of Tottenham's FA Cup third-round tie against Portsmouth on Saturday, BBC Sport looks back at Paul Gascoigne's stunning performance for Spurs against Pompey in 1991.

entries.title: NFL owners approve changes to AFC play-off structure after game cancellation
entries.description: NFL owners approve changes to the AFC play-off structure after the game between the Cincinnati Bengals and the Buffalo Bills was cancelled.

entries.title: Romeo Beckham joins Brentford B on loan from Inter Miami II
entries.description: Romeo Beckham, son of former England captain David, joins Brentford's B team on loan from Inter Miami II until the end of the season.

entries.title: Prince Harry says he was 'bigoted' before he met Meghan
entries.description: In interviews and his book Spare, Prince Harry recalls in detail his own past racism scandals.

entries.title: Premier League, EFL and FA chiefs hold 'positive' talks over game's future
entries.description: Senior figures from the three main football bodies in England hold "positive, open and constructive" discussions about the future of the game.

entries.title: Prince Harry's Spare: Have leaks helped or hindered his book's PR strategy?
entries.description: Revelations from Prince Harry's memoir have upended a carefully co-ordinated marketing strategy.

entries.title: Yorkshire: Lord Patel to step down as chair in March
entries.description: Lord Patel announces he will step down as Yorkshire chair at the club's next annual general meeting in March.

entries.title: Writer Hanif Kureishi seriously injured in fall
entries.description: The creator of The Buddha of Suburbia and My Beautiful Launderette says he believed he "was dying".

entries.title: Raye: Pop star hits number one after gaining independence from major label
entries.description: The star tops the charts as an independent artist, after her label refused to release her debut album.

entries.title: Afghan refugee murdered in row over girl, court told
entries.description: Harzat Wali, 18, was stabbed in Twickenham in October 2021. A youth, 17, is on trial for murder.

entries.title: Can the UK's race to space take off?
entries.description: The first orbital rocket launch from Britain is about to blast off - but it's just the start for the UK's race to space.

entries.title: David Wagner: Norwich City name former Huddersfield boss as new head coach
entries.description: Norwich City appoint former Huddersfield Town boss David Wagner as their new head coach on a 12-month rolling contract.

entries.title: Train drivers offered pay rise in bid to end strikes
entries.description: The Rail Delivery Group says its offer would see wages for drivers rise by £5,000 by the end of 2023.

entries.title: Klopp reiterates opposition to FA Cup replays
entries.description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he is in favour of scrapping FA Cup replays and "other solutions" are needed to support smaller clubs.

entries.title: Lynch vs Sunak: Clash over PM's call for 'grown-up' talks
entries.description: RMT boss criticises the PM for saying he wants a “grown-up conversation” with the unions.

entries.title: Strike daily: How Saturday 7 January's train strikes will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the rail strike and other industrial action, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Victims of Perth hotel fire tragedy named
entries.description: Donna Janse Van Rensburg, Sharon McLean and Keith Russell died in a fire at the New County Hotel.

entries.title: Snooker match-fixing investigation: What is happening as 10 players suspended?
entries.description: How did we get here and what happens next as 10 players are suspended in a corruption inquiry.

entries.title: Six Nations: Harlequins' Nick Evans named England attack coach for tournament
entries.description: England appoint Harlequins' Nick Evans as attack coach on a short-term deal for the 2023 Six Nations.

entries.title: Bet365 gambling boss earns £213m in one year
entries.description: Denise Coates is one of the richest women in Britain, having founded the firm in Stoke-on-Trent.

entries.title: The Swiss ski resort with no snow
entries.description: At the Torgon ski resort in the Valais Alps it's hikers rather than skiers on the slopes.

entries.title: Lawyers expect court challenge to anti-strike laws
entries.description: But Rishi Sunak says ensuring basic services are provided during strikes is "entirely reasonable".

entries.title: Parents missing with newborn last seen on motorway
entries.description: Constance Marten and Mark Gordon went missing with their baby after breaking down on the M61.

entries.title: Obituary: Gianluca Vialli dies aged 58
entries.description: BBC Sport's Jane Dougall reports on the life and career of former Chelsea striker and manager Gianluca Vialli, who has died at the age 58.

entries.title: Virgil van Dijk: Liverpool defender out 'for more than a month' with hamstring issue
entries.description: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk is "out for more than a month" with a hamstring problem, says manager Jurgen Klopp.

entries.title: Tory MP Brendan Clarke-Smith defends 'learn how to budget' remarks
entries.description: Brendan Clarke-Smith says it is unlikely firefighters earning £32,000 a year were using food banks.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Kyiv and Moscow blame each other as Putin's truce falters
entries.description: A unilateral ceasefire called by Russia breaks down within hours of coming into effect.

entries.title: Kevin McCarthy hopes for deal as US House Speaker fight hits day four
entries.description: Republican Kevin McCarthy's bid for the role has been thwarted repeatedly by rebels in his own party.

entries.title: Gianluca Vialli obituary: 'One of the greats with a reputation to match'
entries.description: Gianluca Vialli, who has died aged 58, was one of the modern era's great strikers and also one of its most popular and endearing figures, writes Phil McNulty.

entries.title: Emma Raducanu heads to Melbourne but Australian Open prospects unclear
entries.description: Injured British number one Emma Raducanu is heading to Melbourne, but her prospects of playing in the Australian Open remain unclear.

entries.title: BA unveils jumpsuits in first uniform revamp for 20 years
entries.description: The airline has updated its workwear for the first time in 20 years with designs by Ozwald Boateng.

entries.title: Gianluca Viallli double sends Chelsea into 1997 FA Cup fifth round
entries.description: Watch as Gianluca Vialli nets two goals against Liverpool to send Chelsea into the 1997 FA Cup fifth round.

entries.title: Census data reveals LGBT+ populations for first time
entries.description: The number of LGBT+ people living in England and Wales has been revealed in the 2021 census.

entries.title: See how long hospital waits are in your area
entries.description: Flu, staff shortages and Covid backlogs are putting the NHS under severe strain, find out what's happening in your area.

entries.title: Katharine Birbalsingh: Head teacher quits as social mobility adviser
entries.description: Katharine Birbalsingh has attracted controversy since being appointed in late 2021.

entries.title: Jack Butland: Man Utd sign Crystal Palace goalkeeper on loan
entries.description: Manchester United sign Crystal Palace goalkeeper Jack Butland on loan for the remainder of the season.

entries.title: Prince Harry first heard of Queen Elizabeth's death from BBC website
entries.description: Prince Harry describes how he found about the late Queen's death and his last conversation with her.

entries.title: Junior doctor strike warning for March
entries.description: Members of a union for doctors are to be balloted over a 72-hour walkout in March in England.

entries.title: Harry's Taliban kill remarks tarnish his reputation - ex-commander
entries.description: In his book, Harry describes killing 25 Taliban fighters as being like removing chess pieces from a board.

entries.title: Gridlock as record number of ambulances queue at A&E
entries.description: More than 40% of crews delayed outside hospital, but hope as flu and Covid admissions fall.

entries.title: House prices drop for fourth month in a row
entries.description: The average UK house price fell by 1.5% to £281,272 in December, according to Halifax.

entries.title: Gianluca Vialli: Former Chelsea, Juventus and Italy striker dies aged 58
entries.description: Former Chelsea striker and manager Gianluca Vialli has died at the age 58.

entries.title: Women's T20 World Cup: Alice Capsey and Kate Cross return to England squad
entries.description: Alice Capsey is included in the England squad for the Women's T20 World Cup despite suffering a broken collarbone last month.

entries.title: Edwin Chiloba: LGBTQ activist found dead in Kenya
entries.description: Police are investigating after the designer's body was discovered in a box dumped at the roadside.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin: NFL game will not resume after Buffalo Bills player collapsed on the field
entries.description: The NFL game between the Cincinnati Bengals and Buffalo Bills will not be resumed having been suspended after Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field.

entries.title: FA Cup third round: When Everton shocked Manchester United in 1995 FA Cup final
entries.description: Before their FA Cup third-round meeting at Old Trafford, BBC Sport looks back at Everton and Manchester United's 1995 final at Wembley.

entries.title: Iga Swiatek loses to Jessica Pegula in United Cup
entries.description: World number one Iga Swiatek is left in tears after a straight-set defeat by American Jessica Pegula in the semi-finals of the inaugural United Cup.

entries.title: Prince Harry book: Sex, drugs, rucks and royals
entries.description: The duke's bombshell memoir reveals his grief and anger at losing his trust for his family.

entries.title: Prince Harry: Revelations about drug taking and clash with Prince William
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex opens up about his fractured relationship with his brother.

entries.title: China Covid: Young people self-infect as fears for elderly grow
entries.description: Cases are surging as the country reopens after the sudden reversal of three years of restrictions.

entries.title: Scottish skiing gets lift as European resorts struggle for snow
entries.description: Favourable conditions on Scotland's slopes come as some resorts elsewhere struggle for snow.

entries.title: FA Cup: Chesterfield's Jesurun Uchegbulam on life at AC Milan and heart surgery
entries.description: As non-league Chesterfield look to spring an FA Cup upset against West Brom, Jesurun Uchegbulam talks about his time at AC Milan and having heart surgery at the age of 16.

entries.title: Essex couple's £100k stolen car found in Tilbury en route to Africa
entries.description: Police warn of a rising number of luxury vehicles being stolen to order by criminal gangs.

entries.title: Joan Sydney: Neighbours and A Country Practice star dies at 83
entries.description: The British-Australian actress died aged 83 last Wednesday at her Sydney home after a long illness.

entries.title: Wind generated a record amount of electricity in 2022
entries.description: More electricity in Great Britain last year came from renewable sources than from fossil fuels.

entries.title: Nearly a third of university courses still have hybrid teaching
entries.description: Data from 50 universities shows 28% of courses are like this, compared with 4.1% before the pandemic.

entries.title: UK plan for national mRNA cancer-vaccine advance
entries.description: The government is working with German pharmaceutical company BioNTech on new ways to fight cancer.

entries.title: Leeds 2023: City's year of culture to bring 'lasting legacy'
entries.description: Leeds 2023 is about to begin, bringing a year of cultural celebrations. But how did it come about?

entries.title: Excluded at 12 and a school governor at 26
entries.description: Shekeila Scarlett, one of the youngest people in the UK to chair a board of governors, argues the body should reflect the students.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Harry spills secrets' and 'attacks on strike law'
entries.description: Most of Friday's front pages report on a series of sensational claims in Prince Harry's new memoir.

entries.title: McCarthy loses historic 11th vote for US Speaker
entries.description: The deadlock will continue into a fourth day, since no business can go ahead until a speaker is picked.

entries.title: Jack Grealish says adapting to life at Man City has been 'difficult'
entries.description: Jack Grealish admits his move to Manchester City has been "much more difficult" than he imagined after setting up their winner at Chelsea.
